instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1990: What is A1990? A1990 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2018, 2019 with EMC3215, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01041, 820-01814..
definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP2V5_NAND_SSD0: What is PP2V5_NAND_SSD0? PP2V5_NAND_SSD0 This is a power rail that powers the NAND on Macbooks where the solid state drive is soldered directly to the board. .
definitions.PP0V9_SSD0: What is PP0V9_SSD0? This is a power rail for the soldered on SSD on newer Macbooks. .
definitions.PP1V8_SSD0: What is PP1V8_SSD0? PP1V8_SSD0 is a power rail responsible for powering the soldered on NAND memory for the SSD on newer Macbook Pros.

threads.title: Stuck on DFU <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hi, 

i got a computer that came not powering on, tried to DFU, show error 53.
Any idea what to look for?
tried to rewrite the soc t2 chip, still the same.

The apple screen stuck until power off by force.

threads.title: Stuck on DFU <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
Any history available?

Check diode mode to ground on SSD power rails.

threads.title: Stuck on DFU <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
No history, got it as not working.
no water marks, or something visible.
when power on the trackpad clicks but nothing else.

Diode Mode:
<SIGNAL>PP2V5_NAND_SSD0</SIGNAL> - 0.36v
<SIGNAL>PP0V9_SSD0</SIGNAL> - 0.13v
 <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SSD0</SIGNAL> - 0.37v

SSD1 nothing because there isn't one

threads.title: Stuck on DFU <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: Test DFU with an empty (erased) Soc ROM.
